solution_line_template: If in eight years Brian will be {brian_future_age} years old, he is currently {brian_future_age}-{years_until_future} = <<{brian_future_age}-{years_until_future}={brian_current_age}>>{brian_current_age} years old.
Since Christian is twice as old as Brian, he is {christian_multiplier}*{brian_current_age} = <<{christian_multiplier}*{brian_current_age}={christian_current_age}>>{christian_current_age} years old.

In {years_until_future} years, Christian will be {christian_current_age}+{years_until_future} = <<{christian_current_age}+{years_until_future}={christian_age_in_8_years}>>{christian_age_in_8_years} years old.
